profileText: A Representative from Ohio; born in Jefferson County, Va., December 31, 1817; attended the common schools; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1840 and practiced; moved to Batavia, Ohio; prosecuting attorney 1845-1849; served in the war with Mexico and was made second lieutenant of Company C, Second Regiment, Ohio Volunteer Infantry; member of the State senate 1850-1852; elected as a Democrat to the Thirty-sixth Congress (March 4, 1859-March 3, 1861); commissioned major of the Fifty-ninth Regiment, Ohio Volunteer Infantry, on August 11, 1861, and served until February 24, 1863; resumed the practice of law; died in Batavia, Ohio, June 1, 1891; interment in Union Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In the John Charles Fremont Collection, 1861, 2 pages.
researchRecord.description: A letter from William Howard to Senator William Pitt Fessenden written on August 22, 1861. In the letter, William Howard expresses his desire to enlist approximately 1000 to 1300 sailors as Marine Artillerists for John Charles Fremont to use on his flotilla to travel down the Mississippi River.
